title: New: Saint Savanna – The Lunatic Spell EP
body:
Barely out of school, Brighton trio **Saint Savanna** showcase a songwriting ability well beyond their modest years.

Having [initially](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/19192-introducing-saint-savanna/) (and with a pinch of salt) compared their debut EP, Verona, to destroys of music, Mumford & Sons, their newest release _**The Lunatic Spell**_ banishes any possible Mumford aftertaste, whilst maintaining the pop vibe that attracted me to them in the first place. **_The Lunatic Spell_** toys with the dark, foreboding themes that littered their debut release; mental turmoil, the pains of growing up and an overarching sense of heartbreak induced loneliness. EP opener _With Haste_ is far and away the most immediate, with it’s Alt-J inspired vocals and tales of short-lived yet shattering holiday romances. Having washed off any one-hit wonder doubts, Saint Savanna have ascerted their place as one of the UK’s most exciting new bands. Check out _With_ _Haste_ below, then grab the full EP as a free download.
